text: Maryland Agricultural College founding
Charles Calvert sold the Rossburg farm
Opening of Maryland Agricultural College
Harry Clifton “Curley” Byrd becomes university president
Byrd argues against integration in state legislature meeting
First Black students — Rose Shockley Wiseman, Myrtle Holmes Wake and John Francis — complete their coursework outside of the campus
The NAACP sues the university to accept Parren J. Mitchell, Esther McCready and Hiram Whittle
Parren J. Mitchell was accepted to this university
Hiram Whittle becomes first Black undergraduate student
Wilson H. Elkins announced as next university president
Brown v. Board of Education landmark decision
Board of Regents decide to only accept in-state Black students
Black students ousted from course
Elaine Johnson Coates, first Black woman to graduate from this university, enrolls
Darryl Hill, first Black football player, enrolls
Civil Rights Act passes
Billy Jones, first Black basketball player, enrolls
M. Lucia James, first Black professor at the university
Congress of Racial Equality is founded at this university
Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. is assassinated
CORE becomes BSU
UMD charged with violation of Civil Rights Act of 1964
African American studies department opens at this university
UMD passes desegregation plan in higher education
Banneker/Key scholarship is established
John B. Slaughter, first Black chancellor of UMD, begins his term
